intro: Clematis fusca var. tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly clematis, is a deciduous vine native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its hairy, grayish foliage and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has a climbing habit, with tendrils that allow it to攀援 on supports or other structures. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine, white pubescence, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in partial shade to full sun and prefers moist, well-drained soil.
